result.execSummary:
The defendant Shannon McKeel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes:
Counseling deemed necessary, which may include anger management and parenting classes.

Follow CHIPS order.

records.addlTxt: 10:10 Defendant Shannon McKeel in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Derek Dominguez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury trial - 12 person on December 17, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Defendant Shannon McKeel in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Derek Dominguez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Not guilty plea entered.    Bond continued

11:41 Defendant Shannon McKeel in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Derek Dominguez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Cassandra Borchardt is sworn as a witness.  Testifies to her employment with Wis Rapids Police Dept.  Testifies to contact with CM on 07/24/14 regarding an injury received during altercation with her mother.  Testifies to where the injury took place.  Testifies to contact with CM regarding the altercation.  Testifies to Shannon McKeel being the mother of CM.  Identifies McKeel in the courtroom.  Testifies to observation of bruise on CMs forearm.  Testifies to conversation with Shannon McKeel.  

Atty Slattery cross examines the witness.  Testifies to what Social Worker was present during conversation with CM.  Testifies to date CM indicated that the incident occurred.  Estimates the distance between McKeel and CM in the bedroom.  

Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over for Arraignment.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 31, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on October 2, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Cooperate with Wood County Human Services. Report to WRPD for fingerprinting.
9:50 Defendant Shannon McKeel in court.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bound over for preliminary hearing.
